components.description: A frosted cake with lit candles, as presented for a birthday celebration. The style of cake widely varies across platforms. With white frosting and strawberries, Apple and Google’s designs suggest a Japanese Christmas cake. Other vendors depict a chocolate, pink, and/or sponge cake.
components.title: Birthday Cake

description: A frosted cake with lit candles, as presented for a birthday celebration. The style of cake widely varies across platforms. With white frosting and strawberries, Apple and Google’s designs suggest a Japanese Christmas cake. Other vendors depict a chocolate, pink, and/or sponge cake.
title: Birthday Cake

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Celebration symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A cake with lit candles in the middle, created for someoneâ€™s birthday. The Apple version features strawberries for decoration and flavour. G http://emojipedia.org/birthday-cake/
emoji_net_data.name: birthday cake

bn:00111540a: Having or denoting the characteristic taste of sugar
Having the taste characteristic of sugar or honey.

bn:00102909a: Festive and full of fun and laughter
Festive and full of fun and laughter.
Giving fun, gaiety, joy, and cheerful spirit.

bn:00087460v: To consume something solid or semi-solid (usually food) by putting it into the mouth and eventually swallowing it.
To consume (something solid or semi-solid, usually food) by putting it into the mouth and swallowing it.

bn:00014609n: Cake is a form of bread or bread-like food.
A rich, sweet, baked dessert, typically made with flour, eggs, sugar and butter.
A rich, sweet dessert food, typically made of flour, sugar and eggs and baked in an oven, and often covered in icing.
Baked goods made from or based on a mixture of flour, sugar, eggs, and fat
Form of bread or bread-like food

bn:00010679n: The date and year something was born.
The year, month, and day of someone's birth; date of birth
Date and year when something was born.
A birthday is a celebration of the anniversary of a person's birth.
The date on which someone is born or something is created, more commonly called birthdate or date of birth.
The date on which a person was born.
Day that comes once a year when a person celebrates the anniversary of his or her birth
A birthday is an occasion when a person or institution celebrates the anniversary of their birth.
The date on which a person was born

bn:00010680n: Decorated cake served at a birthday party
Dessert served to celebrate a birthday
A cake often decorated with candles, made to celebrate someone's birthday.
The birthday cake has been an integral part of the birthday celebrations in western European countries since the middle of the 19th century, which extended to Western culture.
A cake, often iced and decorated, made to celebrate a person's birthday.

bn:00001880n: A sweet confection served as the last course of a meal
A dish served as the last course of a meal
A usage seen in the United Kingdom and some other Commonwealth countries.
Dessert is a typically sweet course that concludes an evening meal.
A sweet confection served as the last course of a meal.
Sweet confection served as the last course of a meal.
Sweet course that concludes a meal

bn:00035650n: Any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body. For prepared ready-to-eat food, use dish: Q746549.
Any substance consumed by living organisms to sustain life.
Any substance that can be consumed by living organisms, especially by eating, in order to sustain life.
Any solid substance (as opposed to liquid) that is used as a source of nourishment
Food is any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body.
